item.title: Python
item.description: STATS is so fun! I never thought I would learn so much.We started using python. my_seq1 = “ATCATCATG” my_seq2 = “CAGCCCAATCAGGCTCTACTGCCACTAAACTTACGCAGGATATATTTACGCCGACGTACT” my_dict = {1: ‘ATC’, 2: ‘TCA’, 3:‘CAT’, 4:‘ATG’} print(my_dict) def count_kmers(seq,k): count = {} num= len(seq)-k+1 for i in range(num): kmer=seq[i:i+k] if kmer not in count: count[kmer] +=1 return count count_kmers(“CAGCCCAATCAGGCTCTACTGCCACTAAACTTACGCAGGATATATTTACGCCGACGTACT”) count_kmers(“ATCATCATG”) This code helps is find sequences.

item.title: Statistics
item.description: STATS is so fun! I never thought I would learn so much.We started using python. my_seq1 = “ATCATCATG” my_seq2 = “CAGCCCAATCAGGCTCTACTGCCACTAAACTTACGCAGGATATATTTACGCCGACGTACT” my_dict = {1: ‘ATC’, 2: ‘TCA’, 3:‘CAT’, 4:‘ATG’} print(my_dict) def count_kmers(seq,k): count = {} num= len(seq)-k+1 for i in range(num): kmer=seq[i:i+k] if kmer not in count: count[kmer] +=1 return count count_kmers(“CAGCCCAATCAGGCTCTACTGCCACTAAACTTACGCAGGATATATTTACGCCGACGTACT”) count_kmers(“ATCATCATG”) This code helps is find sequences.

item.title: STATS

item.title: Projects
item.description: Projects Here are some projects I have been working on: Project 1 Project 2

item.title: Project 1: Exploratory Data Analysis
item.description: Data Wrangling and Data Exploration Instructions A knitted R Markdown document (as a PDF) and the raw R Markdown file (as .Rmd) should both be submitted to Canvas by 11:59pm on 10/20/2019. These two documents will be graded jointly, so they must be consistent (i.e., don’t change the R Markdown file without also updating the knitted document). Knit an html copy too, for later! I envision your written text forming something of a narrative structure around your code/output.

item.title: Project 2 Modeling, Testing, and Predicting
item.description: Intro #The ramen data taken from the Ramen Rating website and consists of ramen reviews on a scale from 0-5. The top ten indicates if it ever ranked top 10 in a pervious year with the number 1, while 0 indicates it was not rated top 10 before. Stars indicates the ratings from 0-5, country indicates where the ramen was made, style indicates how it was packaged, variety indicates flavor name and brand is the brand name.
